long: Meaning: properly, "vehemence", i.e. (with or without preposition) "vehemently"; by implication, "wholly", "speedily", etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated).  Usage: diligently, especially, exceeding(-ly), far, fast, good, great(-ly), Ã— louder and louder, might(-ily, -y), (so) much, quickly, (so) sore, utterly, very (  much, sore), well.  Source: from the same as "H181";
